page.title: 03LAND USE-WATER
page.content: The{main land use}in the{Piethorne {valley}is {reservoirs}for drinking water. The main{reservoirs}are called {Kitcliff, Piethorne, Hanging Lees, {Norman hill,Rooden,{Dowry}and{Redycon {dean }reservoirs. All of these reservoirs get their water from little streams which drain from the{ moores }of the{Pennines. The water runs over peat, which makes the water very accidic. Water comes up from{Buterworth Hall Coal Mine }which is alkaline to sweeten the water. The water goes to{Piethorne {treatment works}which is the most modern in Europe this puts chlorine into the water. The water is then filtered so that it is ready to drink. Just to make sure nothing pollutes the water farmers are only allowed to use{organic fertilizers. J/H/5/6/85
